result.execSummary:
The defendant Laurelei L Ryan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jackson County cases 15CM108 and 16CM33

miscConds.notes: Court costs are paid in full out of the bond on file

Must seek and maintain full-time employment or a combination of employment and education commensurate with treatment or mental health needs, which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  Defendant  must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated, insured and agent gives prior approval.  

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants.  Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.
Defendant may apply for expungement if probation successfully completed, has not committed any new crimes, and all court obligations are satisfied.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  

Must comply with any other recommendations of agent for therapy, counseling, or programming that the agent deems appropriate.  

Must follow through with any further AODA currently involved in.

Must submit to random testing by your probation agent.  

Must provide a DNA sample at the Jackson County Jail and pay the surcharge.

May release early after one year if in compliance with all conditions and you are in good standing.

District Attorney Daniel S. Diehn appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Tainter.  Victim notification not required.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No changes or corrections noted.  State recommended:  90 days jail each case concurrent.  Defense requesting time served.   Defendant exercised her right to allocution.  

Court ordered 15CM87:  4 months jail.  15CM108 2 months, jail consecutive to 15CM87.  In 16CM33 2 months jail, concurrent to 15CM108, consecutive to 15CM87.  64 days credit 15CM87.
Greg Tainter
sent to Judge this date.
from DOC
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 20, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant appears in person with counsel Mathew Prior.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  15CM108 - Count 1, Bailjumping, enters plea of guilty; 15CM87 - Count 1, Bailjumping, enters plea of guilty; 16CM33 - Count 1, Bailjumping, enters plea of guilty.  Court reviews elements and plea/waiver of rights colloquy.  Court finds she FVKI enters her plea/waives her rights and a factual basis exists and is found guilty of bailjumping in the 3 cases.  All remaining charges in those cases and other pending cases are DRI.

Probation for 2 years:  Submit a DNA sample, no alcohol or where sold/served.  Undergo an AODA assessment and comply with TX , seek/obtain employ commensurate with treatment needs.  Obtain a valid driver's license.  Submit to a risk and needs assessment and comply with recommended programming/treatment.  Expungment if succesfully completes probation.  

Defense requests 1 year probation with the conditions stated by the State.  Defendant exercises her right to allocution and makes a statement to the Court.

Court adopts the recommendation and orders sentence withheld and places her on probation for 2 years with conditions:  May release early after one year if in compliance with all conditions and are in good standing.  Must undergo a risk and needs assessment, sign all releases necessary for agent to verify compliant.  Must comply with any other recommendations agent for therapy, counseling, or programming that the agent deems appropriate.  Must provide a DNA sample.  Follow through with any further AODA currently involved in.  No operation of motor vehicle, unless insured and have agent's approval.  Not to consume any alcohol or be present where sold or served.  Not to use any drugs.  Random testing on demand by agent.  Seek and obtain employment commensurate with treatment or mental health needs.  May apply for expungement if successfully completes and has not committed any new crimes.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears with counsel Matthew Prior.  DA Kenneth Hamm appears specially for the State.  Attorney Prior states they will schedule for plea/sentencing on all criminal cases and there is also a civil traffic case tracking along.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 11, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on August 16, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 11, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Prior.  Attorney Prior was just appointed.  PTC set for 8/16 and STC set for 9/11 at 3 pm.

THIS IS IN ADDITION TO THE PREVIOUS BOND ALREADY POSTED.  Covers Case No.'s 16CM33, 15CT9, 15CM108, 15CM87 and 15CM16.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  No contact with the Majestic Pines Casino, the facility, or its employees.
Status conference on August 7, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.    The defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  No counsel present.  She was out of town.  STC 8/7 at 3 pm
